p: With the exception of one respondent who self-identified as male, all of the remaining respondents were female (99.5%). The mean age of participants was 50.3 years (SD = 8.4). A large proportion of respondents was between 30 and 39 years of nursing experience ( N = 90, 44.6%), had completed a qualification course ( N = 193, 95.5%) and reported to work in “medium-size” towns of approximately 20,000 inhabitants ( N = 87, 43.1%). The majority of respondents was employed on a contract bases at PHC clinics ( N = 136, 71.8%), fewer owned or co-owned the PHC practice ( n = 57; 28.2%) (Table 1).
